Description: THE YUROK TRIBE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM WILL BUILD THE TRIBE'S CAPACITY TO ASSESS AIR QUALITY CONDITIONS AND TO DEVELOP STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS AIR QUALITY ISSUES. THE TRIBE WILL ADDRESS INDOOR AIR QUALITY ISSUES THROUGH EDUCATION, OUTREACH AND HOME ASSESSMENTS. THE TRIBE WILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE STRATEGIC PLANNING AND EVALUATION, COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE AND OTHER ACTIVITIES AS WARRANTED IN ORDER TO ADDRESS EVOLVING AIR QUALITY ISSUES.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $70,000.  SEE TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO HELP BUILD THE TRIBE'S CAPACITY TO ASSESS AIR QUALITY CONDITIONS AND TO DEVELOP STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS AIR QUALITY ISSUES. THE TRIBE WILL CONTINUE STRATEGIC PLANNING AND EVALUATION, COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE, MONITORING AIR EMISSIONS, RULEMAKING, AND OTHER PROGRAM ACTIVITIES. THESE ACTIVITIES ARE TO IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN THE TRIBE'S AIR QUALITY. 

ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL IMPLEMENT ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE SCOPE OF THE SECTION 105 PROGRAM INCLUDING: 1) TO IMPLEMENT NATIONAL PRIORITIES AS DEFINED IN EPA NATIONAL GUIDANCE AND CONSISTENT WITH EPA'S STRATEGIC PLAN; 2) PROGRAM ACTIVITIES DELEGATED TO THE RECIPIENT, PECHANGA TRIBE, FOR WHICH EPA PROVIDES SECTION 105 GRANT FUNDING. A CONTINUING PROGRAM TYPICALLY INCLUDES, BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO, SUCH ACTIVITIES AS ANALYSIS AND PLANNING FOR ATTAINMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS); CONTROL STRATEGY DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION; REDUCTION OF RISKS FROM HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS; AIR QUALITY MONITORING; AMBIENT AIR QUALITY AND SOURCE MODELING; INVENTORY OF EMISSIONS; REGULATION DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION; NON-TITLE V RELATED PERMITTING AND ENFORCEMENT; PUBLIC OUTREACH; AIR POLLUTION DATA ANALYSIS AND MANAGEMENT; AIR POLLUTION PREVENTION ACTIVITIES; AND OTHER INNOVATIVE APPROACHES TO POLLUTION REDUCTION INCLUDING ECONOMIC INCENTIVE AND MARKET-BASED (ALLOWANCE AND TRADING) PROGRAMS. 

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE COLLECTING AIR QUALITY DATA AND SUBMITTING RESULTS TO EPA'S NATIONAL AIR QUALITY DATABASE. OUTCOMES INCLUDE A BROADENED AWARENESS OF AIR QUALITY ISSUES AND ESTABLISH PROGRAMS TO ADDRESS THE ATTAINMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF NAAQS AS WELL AS IMMEDIATE AND EMERGING THREATS TO PUBLIC HEALTH AND WELFARE FROM AIR POLLUTION. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE THE PECHANGA TRIBE AREA RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED EXPOSURE TO CRITERIA AND HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS. 

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $140,317.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT FROM EPA REGION 10 TO THE TULALIP TRIBE, WHO WILL IMPLEMENT A COMPREHENSIVE AIR QUALITY PROTECTION PROGRAM. THIS PROPOSAL WILL BENEFIT THE PEOPLE OF TEXAS BY PROVIDING EDUCATION, OUTREACH AND TESTING TO HELP MINIMIZE THEIR EXPOSURE TO INDOOR RADON.  INDOOR RADON IN TEXAS IS A HIGHLY LOCALIZED PROBLEM; OUR PRELIMINARY DATA IDENTIFIES TWO REGIONS WITH THE HIGHEST POTENTIAL FOR INDOOR RADON IN THE STATE:  THE TEXAS HIGH PLAINS, LOCATED IN THE PANHANDLE AREA OF TEXAS, AND THE CENTRAL TEXAS UPLIFT, LOCATED WEST OF AUSTIN AND SAN ANTONIO.  THE RECIPIENT WILL PROVIDE TARGETED EDUCATION AND OUTREACH TO THESE AREAS.  THE RECIPIENT WILL ALSO PROVIDE GENERAL EDUCATIONAL PRESENTATIONS AND TESTING OPPORTUNITIES FOR ALL OTHER RESIDENTS OF TEXAS.  THERE ARE NO SUBAWARDS IN THIS AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO ARKANSAS DIVISION OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (ADIEQ).  SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL IMPLEMENT AIR POLLUTION CONTROL PROGRAMS THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF ARKANSAS. INCLUDING CONTINUING DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF STATIONARY SOURCE REGULATIONS; CONTINUING PROMULGATION AND UPDATE OF ENHANCED MOBILE SOURCE REGULATIONS; IMPROVEMENT OF EMISSION INVENTORIES FOR MODELING SIMULATIONS; OPERATING AN AIR MONITORING NETWORK; AND OTHER AIR PLANNING ACTIVITIES. THESE ACTIVITIES ARE TO IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN THE PUBLIC'S AIR QUALITY.ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL IMPLEMENT ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE SCOPE OF THE SECTION 105 PROGRAM INCLUDING: 1) TO IMPLEMENT NATIONAL PRIORITIES AS DEFINED IN EPA NATIONAL GUIDANCE AND CONSISTENT WITH EPA'S STRATEGIC PLAN; 2) ACTIONS MANDATED BY STATUTE OR REGULATION; 3) PROGRAM ACTIVITIES DELEGATED TO THE RECIPIENT (STATE, LOCAL, OR TRIBE) FOR WHICH EPA PROVIDES SECTION 105 GRANT FUNDING. THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ANALYSIS AND PLANNING FOR ATTAINMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS); CONTROL STRATEGY DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION; REDUCTION OF RISKS FROM HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS; AIR QUALITY MONITORING; AMBIENT AIR QUALITY AND SOURCE MODELING; INVENTORY OF EMISSIONS; REGULATION DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION; NON-TITLE V RELATED PERMITTING AND ENFORCEMENT; STAFF TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT; AIR POLLUTION DATA ANALYSIS AND MANAGEMENT; AIR POLLUTION PREVENTION ACTIVITIES; AND OTHER INNOVATIVE APPROACHES TO POLLUTION REDUCTION INCLUDING ECONOMIC INCENTIVE AND MARKET-BASED (ALLOWANCE AND TRADING) PROGRAMS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE:
SIP/PLANNING ACTIVITY
-	SUBMIT DRAFT, PROPOSED, AND/OR FINAL SIPS, EQUIVALENCY DEMONSTRATIONS, AND/OR DELEGATION REQUESTS, AS NECESSARY, IN RESPONSE TO REVISIONS TO NEW OR REVISED FEDERAL RULES OR STATE STATUTES.
-	SUBMIT REVISIONS TO THE SIP, AS NECESSARY, WITHIN THE TIME FRAME ALLOWED BY FEDERAL RULES.

MONITORING ACTIVITY
-	REPORT REAL TIME OZONE, NO2, SO2, AND CO, TO AIRNOW FOR CITIES REQUIRED TO REPORT THE AQI (STATE/LOCAL ONLY).
-	CONTINUE CURRENT FORECASTING. ALSO, CONSIDER EXPANDING AIR QUALITY REPORTING AND FORECASTING TO ADDITIONAL CITIES, INCLUDING PARTICLE POLLUTION FORECASTING. 
-	SUBMIT ANNUAL NETWORK PLAN REQUIRED BY 40 CFR   58.10. 
       -	THE PLAN SHOULD ADDRESS NEW APPLICABLE NAAQS MONITORING REQUIREMENTS.
-	SUBMIT FIVE-YEAR (2025) NETWORK ASSESSMENT REPORT REQUIRED BY 40 CFR   58.10.
-	SUBMIT SLAMS DATA, NCORE, AND QA DATA TO AQS ACCORDING TO SCHEDULE IN 40 CFR PART 58. 

PERMITTING ACTIVITY
-	ENTER BACT/LAER DETERMINATIONS IN THE RBLC.
-	PROVIDE MAJOR NSR (PSD AND NONATTAINMENT NSR) APPLICATIONS TO EPA.
-	PROVIDE DRAFT TITLE V AND NSR PERMITS TO EPA.
-	MAKE CASE BY CASE MACT DETERMINATIONS FOR ALL APPLICABLE SOURCES UNDER SECTION 112(G), INCLUDING APPROPRIATE COMPLIANCE MONITORING MEASURES, AS APPROPRIATE.

EMISSIONS INVENTORY ACTIVITY
-	FINAL SUBMITTAL OF POINT SOURCE INVENTORY WILL BE COMPLETED BY DEQ 
-	POINT SOURCE DATA WILL BE CHECKED FOR QUALITY ASSURANCE, VALIDATED, AND REVISED AS NEEDED.
-	COLLECT, REVIEW, AND PREPARE EMISSIONS DATA FOR EACH REPORTING YEAR. 
-	DEQ WILL COLLECT ANY TOXIC EMISSIONS DATA PROVIDED BY FACILITIES AND REPORT IT FOR THE INTEGRATED HAP EMISSIONS INVENTORY.

COMPLIANCE ACTIVITY
-	SUBMIT A COMPLIANCE MONITORING STRATEGY OR AN UPDATE TO THE STRATEGY, INCLUDING THE NUMBER OF MAJOR AND 80% SM SOURCES CONSISTENT WITH THE REVISED CLEAN AIR ACT STATIONARY SOURCE COMPLIANCE MONITORING STRATEGY DATED OCTOBER 4, 2016.

-	COMPLETE THE UNIVERSE OF PLANNED INSPECTIONS AND DOCUMENT FINDINGS CONSISTENT WITH THE COMPLIANCE MONITORING STRATEGY (CMS). INCLUDE:
        -   IDENTIFIED UNIVERSE OF MAJORS AND 80% SM;

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE ARKANSAS DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT, DIVISION OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (ADIEQ) IN ITS EFFORTS TO IMPLEMENT AIR POLLUTION CONTROL PROGRAMS THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF ARKANSAS.#8239; INCLUDING CONTINUING DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF STATIONARY SOURCE REGULATIONS; CONTINUING PROMULGATION AND UPDATE OF ENHANCED MOBILE SOURCE REGULATIONS; IMPROVEMENT OF EMISSION INVENTORIES FOR MODELING SIMULATIONS; OPERATING AN AIR MONITORING NETWORK; AND OTHER AIR PLANNING ACTIVITIES. THESE ACTIVITIES ARE TO IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN THE PUBLIC'S AIR QUALITY.ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL IMPLEMENT ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE SCOPE OF THE SECTION 105 PROGRAM INCLUDING: 1) TO IMPLEMENT NATIONAL PRIORITIES AS DEFINED IN EPA NATIONAL GUIDANCE AND CONSISTENT WITH EPA'S STRATEGIC PLAN; 2) ACTIONS MANDATED BY STATUTE OR REGULATION; 3) PROGRAM ACTIVITIES DELEGATED TO THE RECIPIENT (STATE, LOCAL OR TRIBE) FOR WHICH EPA PROVIDES SECTION 105 GRANT FUNDING.#8239;#8239;A CONTINUING PROGRAM TYPICALLY INCLUDES, BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO, SUCH ACTIVITIES AS: ANALYSIS AND PLANNING FOR ATTAINMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS NAAQS; CONTROL STRATEGY DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION; REDUCTION OF RISKS FROM HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS; AIR QUALITY MONITORING; AMBIENT AIR QUALITY AND SOURCE MODELING; INVENTORY OF EMISSIONS; REGULATION DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION; NON-TITLE V RELATED PERMITTING AND ENFORCEMENT; STAFF TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT; AIR POLLUTION DATA ANALYSIS AND MANAGEMENT; AIR POLLUTION PREVENTION ACTIVITIES; AND OTHER INNOVATIVE APPROACHES TO POLLUTION REDUCTION INCLUDING ECONOMIC INCENTIVE AND MARKET-BASED (ALLOWANCE AND TRADING) PROGRAMS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:OUTCOMES INCLUDE A#8239;BROADENED AWARENESS OF AIR QUALITY PROGRAMS THAT ARE ESTABLISHED TO ADDRESS THE ATTAINMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF (NAAQS) AS WELL AS IMMEDIATE AND EMERGING THREATS TO PUBLIC HEALTH AND WELFARE FROM AIR POLLUTION (CAA 105(A)). #8239;

DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE THE STATE IF ARKANSAS RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED EXPOSURE TO CRITERIA AND HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS.#8239;#8239;
